title: CREPES NOT CRAP
name: CREPES NOT CRAP
description:
A Map by Wendolyne

Let's face it: a bad crepe reverberates. Please be my guest if you'd care to share your creperie tales.

properties.name: Ceasar Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Madamegonzaga  208 Valencia Street, San Francisco CA Good Morning, Glory! Some of the good folks of Ceasar Cafe: Edith, The Great Mario, and Joan. _____________________ If you\'ve lived in the City for awhile, you\'ve probably enjoyed one of Joan and Sam\'s fine homey coffee shops. They were on Valencia near New College at one time and that\'s where I first came to depend on them for my morning jolt. Now they\'re further up Valencia, still serving up a decent meal for a fair price--in fact the menu is pretty robust and even tastier these days. I was impressed by the generous girth of my breakfast crepe and would have happily shared halfsies with a friend. Salads, bagels, sandwiches, caffeine, whatever keeps ya going, get it here. ___________ Open Monday through Friday 6:30AM-10PM, Saturday 8AM-10PM, Sunday 8AM-8PM (grill closes at 7PM on Sundays) 415.621.3800

properties.name: Chocolate, Banana, Whipped Cream and Ice-Cream Crepe
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Need I say more? It is a crying shame that the chairs are so horrendously uncomfortable. I guess that\'s their way of limiting how long people sit and use the free wifi over a cup of coffee.

properties.name: Crepe Express: Taste Paris!
properties.description: Posted by Wendolyne 1476 Haight Street, San Francisco CA Danielle and Brian creating heavenly crepes. ~~~~ Sweet or savory>? My usual is the Opera (ham/swiss/mushrooms) but I\'ve been known to go to the Louvre (dark chocolate sauce) on occasion. The efficient workers here always deliver the goods and the mochas are surprisingly delicious for a place that specializes in something else. You can always swig Orangina or French Limonade if it\'s too late for caffeine--but it\'s really never too late for caffeine, is it? I seem to forget when ensconced in the wafting aromatic goodness of crepes, but the crepe-shy can also get a pretty good salad (Spinach salad with feta/red onions and tomatoes, Nicoise, Gorgonzola/Walnut) or opt for a baguette. Tables aren\'t guaranteed but it\'s okay to tell someone to scoot the heck over...or you can get your goodies to go if you\'re a good juggler. Consistently excellent service and taste. __________ Open 7days from 9:30am-10pm weekdays, 11pm on Fridays and Saturdays. 415.865.0264

properties.name: Crepes on Cole
properties.description: Posted by Mcmcilvoy100 Carl St, San Francisco, CACrepes on Cole. A place for crepes. They are always hiring, and they only hire girls, and the turnover is insane, which gives me the creeps. Creeps and crepes. I recommend the Cole Valley

properties.name: Crepeville
properties.description: Posted by GpwielandCrepeville is one of several newish crepe places in Sacramento. It is counter service, which I hate, but still. The crepes are ok, and the choices are plentiful. We got it for take out, and it was alright but not stellar. There are several locations around Sacramento.

properties.name: Crepevine
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 5600 College Avenue Oakland CaHours: Sun to Thurs 7:30 am to 11 pm Frid & Sat 7:30 am to 12 midnight Middle Eastern, Crepes. Vegetarian dishes. Not pure vegetarian. Menu: Crepes with an option of fillings such as grilled eggplants, cheddar cheese, spinach, peppers, pine nuts and peanut sauce. Other Info: Cafeteria-style, take-out. Place order at counter and food is brought to you. No credit card; cash only.

properties.name: La Creperie Café
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 5110 E. Second St., Long Beach, CAThis Provencal-inspired cafe offers perfection drenched in butter and sugar with a twist of lemon. The best crepes in town!

properties.name: Lemon Crepe & Coffee company
properties.description: Posted by Galway dawson street Dublin irelandGreat espresso based drinks - rosetta most of the time on the latte. Worth a diversion.

properties.name: Paris, France
properties.description: Posted by Bluenude3Paris, FranceI spent the last two weeks of my summer abroad in Paris. I was alone the first week and then Matt joined me for the second. I subsisted mainly on fresh fruit from the markets, crepes from the stands, eclairs, french bread, and wine. Saw all the normal things the Louvre, the Opera Garnier, the Eiffel Tower, the Pantheon, the Musee Orsey, the National Modern Art Musuem, Notre Dame, Sacre\' Coeur, and Chartres Cathedral. Favorite times - seeing the Blue Nude III in the Modern, walking the Seine, the holy feeling inside Notre Dame, and the majesty of Chartres\' stained glass. Wonderful, wonderful, and two weeks wasn\'t enough!

properties.name: Sweet Peas Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edubya  Yummy cafe with delicious sandwiches, salads and CREPES! Did I say CREPES? Why, yes I did!

properties.name: Ti Couz Creperie
properties.description: Posted by Jimyoung 3108 16th St, San Francisco, CA 94103

properties.name: Topher O'Grady ov Destino nuevo latino bistro
properties.description: Posted by Madamegonzaga  1815 Market Street, San Francisco CA Topher eez ze amicable fellow hoo doth ze tending ov ze bar at Destino\'s. I ham veddy munch looxing forweird tou injoying ze two-fur-one mojitos heer from now on every Moonday-Thurstday from 5-7pm. Seee aryooo zare! Fur brunchings on Sundaes betwixxxt 11:30-2pm I shall injoy ze broiled day boat scallops blanketeded wif ze garlic buds und parmesan cheeeeeeese. Nicey place tou tayketh yore new fluffer! (415)552-4451
